pr_title: PARQUET-1743: Add equals API to BloomFilter interface

timeline.message: PARQUET-1743: Add equals API to BloomFilter interface

timeline.bodyText: Why only these 3 checks while there are several other properties like minimumBytes?
timeline.author: shangxinli

replies.bodyText:
@shangxinli
Sorry for the late reply.
Other properties like BYTES_PER_BLOCK are for internal use, any small change will lead to a different bitset.
So I thought no need to check them.
replies.author: garawalid

replies.bodyText: It depends on the usage of this method. BYTES_PER_BLOCK is fine but why minimumBytes is not checked since maximumBytes is chcked?
replies.author: shangxinli

replies.bodyText:
The implementation of bloom-filter branch takes in the constructor only maximumBytes. You re right, it's a mistake.
What about ignoring both the maximumBytes and the minimumBytes, since they will lead to a different size of bitset?
replies.author: garawalid

replies.bodyText: Again, it depends on the usage of this method. If it is a mistake, I would prefer to fix that mistake and come back with right approach.
replies.author: shangxinli

replies.bodyText: I’ll see what I can do!
replies.author: garawalid
